1.content:
If you read the introduction, you know who you are already.

Well? What are you waiting for? Death?
1.title: Journey's Start

choices: 2 Daggers and a staff of light
1 Dagger, a short sword and a shield
1 Dagger, a long sword and a mace
2 Daggers, a short sword and throwing stars
A short sword, a long sword and a shield
11.content:
Before we go farther, certain things must be known. I find that if I lay it out, it's easier to follow later on.

Here goes.

You are a beautiful warrior elf by the name of Sharla DarkLeaf, hailing from the land of SylverDawn. It is known that you have magic powers and a magic stone but that is all. You must choose your weapons here.

Obviously, you carry a long bow and a quiver of never ending arrows. That is a given.

You wear green clothes of the forest but possess a golden gown for those rare occasions when you appear before royalty.

Your hair is golden blonde with silver streaks that is long, past your knees, often braided, your eyes are gray, your lips a perfect shade of pink, full and shapely, nestled against pale flesh. Your cheeks are naturally rosy with sparkles dancing across them.

You are strong, lithe and powerful. You are still considered young by the elves, although you are over three hundred years old.

Now, choose your weapons. Choose wisely.
11.title: Sharla

111.content:
All right, now you also carry 2 daggers and the Staff of Light. Good choice, I must say.

The daggers can be used for up close and personal combat, so they are very important to have.

The Staff of Light is a very powerful staff. It has such power that the bearer can often not control it. The exception, of course, is you. You and the staff were made for each other.

It's called the Staff of Light because that is the one spell most possessor's could perform safely. The small blue stone at the top of the staff will glow and illuminate even the darkest place with warm, efficiant light.

The word is Bellaces.

You might want to make a note of that because the word must be 'said' in order for the staff to light. No tricks now.

You also obtained the Orb of Forsaken Fire, which will create fire anywhere, even in water. You also received 1,000 copper pieces and 75 silver pieces. The exchange rate is 1 silver piece=175 copper pieces. Use the money wisely. Not all things are free.

From this point on, the story shall continue in first person.
111.title: Two Daggers and the Staff of Light

1111.content:
I slowly walk down the path, all the others are behind me, I have gone to scout ahead, having good eyesight. I stare out into the clear night and down into the valley. It is the elven valley my father lives in, my mother had lived in Galendia, a land not far from the sea that she loved, but 100 years ago she was killed in battle. I know Death knows how much this place means to me but the others don't have to know.

"There's a valley up here, we've reached Alanis, the capital of all the elven cities." I yell back to them.

"WE WANT TO TRUST THEM BUT ON THIS JOURNEY WE CAN NOT, DO NOT TELL THEM ANYTHING." I hear Death call forward. "YOU CAN NOT TELL YOUR FATHER OF OUR MISSION, NOR CAN YOU TELL DARIAN. DARIAN LOVES YOU AND WOULD NEVER LET YOU COUNTINUE, AS WOULD BE THE REACTION OF YOUR FATHER.' Death whispers in my head.

I hear a whistle from Micheal, he has never seen an elven city, that's what he had told us on the journey.

"So are we staying here?" Micheal asks.

We look at each other, deciding.
1111.title: Landing on Alanis

11112.content:
"We will stay in the home of my fathers." I say after a long moment of silence.

"WELL I HAVE TO ADMITT, EVEN THOUGH I DO NOT EAT OR SLEEP I AM RATHER READY FOR A BIT OF REST." Death replies.

"If we must." Shadow says darkly.

"You mean we're staying in an elven city? Yes! I'll buy everyone a round at the bar!" Micheal says, jumping down from his horse.

"They don't have bars here but they have ale avaliable if that's what you wish to have. We elves don't often drink the liquid but we keep it for when we have guests. We prefer Dreamberry wine." I say, my eyes shining, I would see my father and beloved Darian again.

"DON'T GET TOO HASTY, DON'T TELL THEM ABOUT OUR QUEST!" Death warns us all, "AND YOU, MICHEAL, DON'T GET TOO DRUNK AND TELL THEM!"

"Now I have never gotton so drunk I've let my tounge slip, well except for that one time, but that was a completely different, oh fine I won't get that drunk." Micheal says.

He is a fine young man, and good to have on our side when he isn't too busy searching for ale. Now Shadow on the other hand, well he worries me, Shadow seems like one of the warlocks who want complete world domination, if you get what I'm saying. Death is somewhat an enjoyable fellow, and he isn't a bad person to have on your side either.

We walk down into the valley, where my father and Darian great us with joy. Darian and I run off together, joyous to see each other once more.

Darian pulls me off to his quarters, "So what is this quest you're on?"

"In all honesty I have no notion, they came to the town of my mother's and asked for the best warrior elf there and they choose me. That is all I know, but enough of that. What have you been up to? How have you been?"

"None of that matters now that your here." He says, wrapping his arms around me and kissing me ever so softly, "Love, I missed you so, please promise me you'll come back here after your quest, please?"

"Of course." I say in a hushed voice and we fall asleep in each other's arms, completely clothed, and rest peacefully.

The sun has barely rosen and I feel a mental prod, "COME NOW, YOU'VE HAD YOUR NIGHT, IT IS TIME TO LEAVE, AND MAKE SURE TO SAY FARWELL TO YOUR FATHER AS WELL AS DARIAN." Death whispers in my mind.

I sigh and rouse Darian, "Love, I must leave now." I whisper. I kiss his lips lightly and then I walk to my father's quarters, "Father?" I call into the room.

"Ah, Sharla, I was afraid you would not come and see me before you left once more."

"I always do father. I love you, I will miss you, goodbye." I say hugging him.

"Love you sweetheart. Have a good journey."

I meet Shadow, a hung-over Micheal, and Death in the town square, "Are you ready at last, then?" asks Shadow coldly. At my nod, we walk off into the growing light of morning.

We soon come to a fork in the road.

"Left or Right?" Micheal, whose hang-over was gone now, asks. Which way should we go?
11112.title: Old Friends

112.content:
All right, now you also carry 1 dagger, a short sword and a shield.

The dagger is used for up close and personal combat, so it is very important to have.

The short sword is also a good weapon to have since it is relatively light and can be weilded one handed. This also means that you can strap it at your hip, rather than across your back.

The shield straps to your forearm and leaves your hand free but useless, since it is blocked by the shield. This is truly only beneficial protection with a short sword, since a long sword uses two hands to weild and therefore, the shield cannot be used.

You also obtained the Orb of Forsaken Fire, which will create fire anywhere, even in water. You also received 1,000 copper pieces and 75 silver pieces. The exchange rate is 1 silver piece=175 copper pieces. Use the money wisely. Not all things are free.

From this point on, the story shall continue in first person.
112.title: One Dagger, a short sword and a shield

113.content:
All right, now you also carry 1 dagger, a long sword and a mace.

The dagger is used for up close and personal combat, so it is very important to have.

The long sword is a great weapon to have since it causes the greatest damage. Unfortunately, it is weilded two handed. This means that you must strap it across your back, making it somewhat difficult to remove while in battle. It helps to have the sword in your hand before the battle begins, but that isn't always possible.

The mace takes a lot of power to weild, for the first blow must crack the armor, the second must kill or wound. It takes a lot of training and, unfortunately for you, you haven't had any. Therefore, before you can use the mace, you must find someone to train you. That's the price you pay.

You also obtained the Orb of Forsaken Fire, which will create fire anywhere, even in water. You also received 1,000 copper pieces and 75 silver pieces. The exchange rate is 1 silver piece=175 copper pieces. Use the money wisely. Not all things are free.

From this point on, the story shall continue in first person.
113.title: One dagger, a long sword and a mace

All right, now you also carry 2 daggers, a short sword and throwing stars.

The daggers can be used for up close and personal combat, so they are very important to have.

The short sword is also a good weapon to have since it is relatively light and can be weilded one handed. This also means that you can strap it at your hip, rather than across your back.

The throwing stars are fairly new to the land. They are not as accurate as arrows so you don't use them very often. They also aren't never ending and so you must always retrieve and sharpen dulling stars. The stars can also be tainted with poison, if you wish to give someone a very painful and slow death. You don't do this because you are an elf, but you have seen it done.

You also obtained the Orb of Forsaken Fire, which will create fire anywhere, even in water. You also received 1,000 copper pieces and 75 silver pieces. The exchange rate is 1 silver piece=175 copper pieces. Use the money wisely. Not all things are free.

From this point on, the story shall continue in first person.

choices: Death (as if you needed this one, right?)
12.content:
Before we go farther, certain things must be known. I find that if I lay it out, it's easier to follow later on.

Here goes.

You are Shadow Blacke, a dark warlock, and you carry no weapons for your magic is powerful enough.

What you must decide here is which spell you possess. You can choose only one and you can't perform the other spells ever.

You are dark haired and dark skinned, with a slight build, with amber colored eyes. You cut quite an intimidating figure. It would be more intimidating in you wore black, but alas, you do not dress in black, you dress in white.

You have a staff but that is all it is: a piece of wood. It has no magical qualities whatsoever.

You are truly glad to be with Death since you fear Him greatly. You'd rather have Him near you than hunting you.

Well, choose your spell. You have regular spells, of course, but these are the most powerful and can't be dealt any other way.
12.title: Shadow

121.content:
Ah, you have chosen the Death Spell. Don't fully trust your travel companion, I guess. Oh well.

This spell will kill all around you. Unfortunately, it will kill friend as well as foe. Since you are an evil wizard, you really shouldn't care...right?

The words for this spell are Shrell Absolam Blea Durr

You also have obtained the book Wisdom Spells and Carnal Desires which possess the spells of intelligance and gain. Use it carefully for not all wisdom and aquirement is good.

You have a dagger, just in case of combat, but it usually won't come to that since you are a magic user. You can also use your staff for a weapon.

From now on, the story will be written in first person.
121.title: Death Spell

122.content:
Ah, you have chosen the AllConsumingFlames Spell. That was a rather good choice.

This spell will cause all around you to burst into flames. Unfortunately, the flames cannot be smothered. No water or any force of nature or man can put it out. Only magic can extinguish the AllConsumingFlames. You must not leave them burning, otherwise they will consume the world.

The words for this spell are Flare Belay Sha Du

You do not know the spell that would extinguish the flames so you also have obtained the book Magical Spells of a Single Purpose and Use which possess the spells that can only be used once before you forget them and have to memorize them once more. They are spells that are only good for one purpose.

In other words, if a spell is used for fanning flames and it summons a mighty wind, you cannot use the spell for propelling your ship upon a calm sea.

You have a dagger, just in case of combat, but it usually won't come to that since you are a magic user. You can also use your staff for a weapon.

From now on, the story will be written in first person.
122.title: AllConsumingFlames Spell

123.content:
Ah, you have chosen the Love Spell. That was a rather poor choice.

This spell will cause one person, and one person only, to fall madly in love with you. Unless you remove the spell, the person will pine away and die. Even after their death, the spell will linger and their spirit will stalk you and all will be lost. For, the Love Spell can only be cast upon one person at a time. If the person dies, the spell can never be lifted and you can never utter it again. Not to mention that you'd have a hopelessly devoted spirit traveling with you and Death

The words for this spell are Amore Barreth Shame Durkke

You also have obtained the book Battle Magic and Spells of Shame which possess the spells that can turn the tide of battle and spells that can never be spoken of because they are so shameful. In other words, the spells of shame are the darkest magic arts a wizard can possess.

You have a dagger, just in case of combat, but it usually won't come to that since you are a magic user. You can also use your staff for a weapon.

From now on, the story will be written in first person.
123.title: Love Spell

choices: Sharla comes to Shadow in the morning
Death disagrees with Shadow's plans for Sharla
1231.content:
I am Shadow and I seek out someone to help me in my quest to rule the world. I am a strong warlock and very intelligent. I must make a journey to the Tower of Bellock, It is a long journey and I must have a flunky to do the grueling work of lighting fires, cooking meals, and running any other thing I can think of for him to do.
I know that many fear me and I fear none other than the one the call DEATH!
I will have Sharla to be my guide, and if she refuses I'll cast a love spell upon her and she will love me until death and beyond. She will do anything for me because of her deep feelings of love towards me. She can guide me with her magical stone to the Tower of Bellock.

"YOU CAN CAST A SPELL ON THE ELF TO HAVE YOUR WAY, BUT YOU WILL STILL HAVE FAR TO GO IN ORDER TO RULE THE WORLD!

Yes Death, I am aware of that but it will get me closer to my goals. My book of Battle magic and spells of shame will help me and so will the unwitting Elf, Sharla.

Sharla will be near in the morning, I have already cast a spell on her to make her love me, she will come looking for me by morning I guarantee it.
1231.title: I am Shadow!

124.content:
Ah, you have chosen the Confusion Spell. That was an all right choice.

This spell will cause one person or an army, to become utterly and completely confused. They will turn on each other or fight trees and rocks. The spell only lasts for a short time, however, so you must either attack with other magic and kill or flee.

The words for this spell are Lost Fror Darake Bleathe

You also have obtained the book Potions and Magical Items which possess the spells that can be used to locate lost magical items or create your own. Only some items can be 'spelled' so be wary of what you cast the spells upon. Potions can be tricky. You must make sure you have the items needed to create the potion, otherwise things can go terribly wrong. No substitutions.

You have a dagger, just in case of combat, but it usually won't come to that since you are a magic user. You can also use your staff for a weapon.

From now on, the story will be written in first person.
124.title: Confusion Spell

125.content:
Ah, you have chosen the Blindness Spell. That was a fair choice.

This spell will cause one person or an army, to become utterly and completely blind. The spell permenant, however, so you must be very careful of who you cast it upon.

The words for this spell are Black Frothe Shorrd Rarra

You also have obtained the book Herbal Remedies and Powerful Spells of Long Ago which possess the spells that are rumored to be lost. These spells were complied by the greatest wizards that ever lived and is therefore a true blessing to have in your possession. There may be an herbal remedy to use soon after the Blindness Spell in order to save someone's sight but you must use it quickly and properly. No substitutions.

You have a dagger, just in case of combat, but it usually won't come to that since you are a magic user. You can also use your staff for a weapon.

From now on, the story will be written in first person.
125.title: Blindness Spell

13.content:
Before we go farther, certain things must be known. I find that if I lay it out, it's easier to follow later on.

Here goes.

You are Michael Fawne, a human archer who fights on the side of good and labors to save those who are lost.

You love to drink but that is not truly your fault. A witch, beautiful though she was, cast a spell on you. She knew you were strong and she knew that you were good. It was under the guidence of Shadow that she cursed you. That's the way it goes.

Obviously, only the witch that cast the spell can deliver you from the spell. So it is that during your travels, you are looking for the witch.

You have a short bow and a quiver of arrows. Unfortunately, you are not an elf and therefore, your arrows can, and do, run out. You retrieve those you can but mainly you have to find ways to make more.

That is why you have 3 daggers, a whet stone, the means to melt and shape metal into arrowheads, a long sword and a throwing spear.

You have brown hair that hangs just past your shoulders, which you often tie back with scraps of leather, and green eyes. You are muscular and prideful, despite your humble beginnings.

You ignore Death often, choosing not to converse with him. Yet, he seems to enjoy cursing you with his clever statements.

Please note that the conversation used in the intro is up for grabs, for Michael and Death are speaking there. Feel free to use it in one of your entries, if no one else has that is.

So, you must wonder what you are to choose here. Why your curse, of course.

What drink do you favor?
13.title: Michael

131.content:
Have a taste for spicy strong drink, eh?

Rum is fairly easy to come by but it is costly. That witch sure knew what she was doing, making you love rum.

Johnny and Orlando like rum too, ahem!

If this were a pirate's story, you'd fit right in.

There are pirates around, by the way, so if you have trouble finding rum, just find a pirate. I'm sure he'd be kind enough to direct you to the proper tavern.

You have 10,000 coppers (which are like pennies) and 681 silvers. Rum cost 1 silver a mug or 175 coppers plus 85 coppers. In other words, 1 silver 85 coppers or 260 coppers.

Happy drinking!

From now on you will tell of your tale in first person.
131.title: Rum

choices: A number of the king's guards patrolling the forest (Enemies)
1311.content:
Michael the cursed is my name. Not my real name though. Just the name "It" calls me by.

"NOW NOW MICHAEL. IT'S NOT POLITE TO CALL ME "IT"." said Death chuckling.

The bastard can read my thoughts. I forgot. It knows the deepest darkest corners of my psyche. It knows what stirs me and what makes me shiver. It knows my pleasures and my fears and lets no chance slip by without torturing me with it.

"MICHAEL! I DON'T TORTURE YOU. WE PLAY GAMES. WE HAVE FUN. LIKE FRIENDS MICHAEL." It said.

"Well I don't like your games and I don't want you as my friend so why wont you just leave me alone?" I replied.

"YOU KNOW WHY. BECAUSE WE HAVE A COMMON ENEMY. THE WITCH THAT LAY THE SPELL ON YOU. I WANT TO CLAIM HER SOUL FOR MY OWN BUT I CAN'T LAY A HAND ON HER. YOU CAN MICHAEL. EVEN DEATH HAS ITS LIMITS." replied Death.

"Even Death has its limits." I repeated.

Death came closer to me. Close enough to whisper in my ear and close enough for me to feel the chill of the grave in it's voice.

"YOU WANT HER DEAD DON'T YOU MICHAEL? BUT FIRST YOU'LL MAKE HER REMOVE THAT WICKED SPELL SHE PLACED ON YOU. DO YOU DREAM OF TORTURING HER MICHAEL? DREAM OF HEARING HER PLEAD FOR MERCY WHILE YOU WATCH HER WRITHE IN AGONY WITH A SMILE ON YOUR FACE?"

"What is it to you what I will do to her? You want her dead and I'll deliver her to you. What I do to her while she is alive is my business. She will remove the curse she lay on me and then she will suffer for everything she has done to me and all that she has cost me."

I tugged my rucksack over my head and reached for the bottle of Rum inside of it. That was my curse. The witch had made me sickly addicted to Rum. I need it to live. It is not the hardest drink to come by but it is the worst of all the drinks. No bright side to it. Just the thick taste of it and the buzz it gives me. Nothing to make me enjoy it. Who the hell enjoys a curse anyway?

"MICHAEL THE CURSED.HE WAS NOT THE FIRST.HIS CURSE WAS HIS THIRST.OH IT IS THE WORST." Sang Death.

I hate that song because it only serves to remind me of my condition.

"I KNOW. THAT'S WHY I SING IT." Said Death laughing slightly.

I ignored Death. I uncorked the bottle of Rum and took a few drinks from it. That helped in soothing the pain that had started to build inside of me and it made the rest of the hike uphill easier. I was headed for a town by the sea where I heard that a bunch of seamen had seen the witch I was seeking on their travels. I meant to ask them to take me there and perhaps even refresh my supplies for cheese, bread and most importantly Rum. My poison.

"DO YOU THINK THEY WILL TAKE YOU THERE? THEY WERE PROBABLY SCARED OUT OF THEIR WITS BY THE MERE SIGHT OF THAT HAG. YOU DON'T REMEMBER HER FACE BUT I DO. TRUST ME SHE IS AN UGLY ONE. MEDUSA TURNED MEN TO STONE, THIS ONE TURNS THEM BLIND."

"Do you like the sound of your voice or do you just like to bother me? I really don't care if they take me up there or not. I just want to know where it is and I'll go alone if I have to. Besides I need to head to the town anyway. I need food and Rum."

Suddenly I heard a rustle coming from the bushes in front of me. I crouched behind a bush to the side and peered between it's entangled branches pulling out my dagger. At close range I'd rather fight with a dagger.
1311.title: I am Michael!

choices: Michael waits for them to leave.
13111.content:
I crouched waiting for the source of the sound coming towards my position. The bush offered me cover from whatever was advancing and I lay waiting for whatever to come close enough.

In a few minutes I heard human voices and the rattling of armor and through the branches I could see a group of five men armed and armored marching together in formation. The emblem on their shields was the emblem of the king.

"THE KING! A GOOD FRIEND OF YOURS." chuckled Death.

The king had been the reason Michael had this curse on him. Michael had been the king's most trusted scout and messenger and secretly a spy. When the king's daughter fell ill the king went insane. He spent every gold piece in the treasury looking for a cure and then when medicine failed he resorted to magic. And that's why Michael was sent to talk to the witch. Rumor had it that she could even bring the dead back to life and so the king sent Michael to talk to her. What the king failed to realize was that a witch that is as powerful as her wouldn't have amassed that much knowledge and power without sacrificing her soul in return and that left her with a thirst for magic and no soul or mercy inside. Either way when she saw him she didn't even bother listening. Just cursed and cast him away. Since that day he hasn't returned to the king and he's been hunting the witch.

"AREN'T YOU GOING TO ATTACK?" whispered Death greedily. The prospect of somebody dying and him adding a life to his collection was something that always made Death happy.

"No. I'm not stupid enough to attack five armed men alone. They're just patrolling the forest looking for bandits. I'll just wait for them to leave before I move on." I whispered.
13111.title: A number of the king's guards patrolling th...

132.content:
Ale! The easiest to find and foulest tasting drink you can ask for.

Ale is very easy to come by but it can be foul. That witch sure knew what she was doing, making you love ale.

Occasionally, you will stumble into a tavern that just doesn't know how to make ale. You'll drink it anyway, of course.

You can usually have five mugs of ale for two coppers, so your drinking 'habit' comes fairly cheap. I mean, honestly, would you pay a lot to vomit foul tasting swill?

I didn't think so.

You have 3,200 coppers (which are like pennies) and 182 silvers. Exchange rate is 1 silver=175 coppers.

Happy drinking!

From now on you will tell of your tale in first person.
132.title: Ale

133.content:
Dwarf Spirits! Are you dumb or just desperate? Oh yeah, you're cursed.

Dwarf Spirits taste great it's just that the only place to obtain them is at dwarf run taverns. Those are foul smelling, messy places. They are also few and far between, so you must make sure you have plenty of skins to carry extra Spirits in.

Oh yeah, they are also expensive. The only drink more costly that Dwarf Spirits is rum. Good luck with either of these drinks. But you chose Dwarf Spirits and they are definately the better tasting choice of the two.

Of course, nothing compares to the elven drink but you chose this one.

You have 8,150 coppers (which are like pennies) and 363 silvers. Dwarf Spirits cost 1 silver a mug or 175 coppers.

Happy drinking!

From now on you will tell of your tale in first person.
133.title: Dwarf Spirits

134.content:
Dreamberry Wine! Ah, to drink this elven concotion is truly heaven.

Finding it, though, is hell. That witch sure knew what she was doing, making you love Dreamberry Wine.

Fortunately for you, you begin your journey with three and a half skins of wine.

Unfortunately, you can only obtain more from an elven village or an elven brewer, and those are both few and far between.

I wish I could say that you will be lucky and find one constantly, but alas, that would be lying. There will be times when you are completely out of wine (oh the horrors!) and those will be torturous days indeed.

The upside to Dreamberry Wine is that the elves aren't a greedy lot. They are a proud lot. Which means that usually a lot of well placed compliments will usually supply you with more wine.

Dreamberry Wine cannot be found in taverns but you may occasionally find a lucky traveler willing to part with some if they happen to have any. They do not take compliments, however, they take silver...lots of silver.

Your best bet is to find elves. Who knows? Maybe an elf will also give you a quiver of never ending arrows.

Eh, one can dream, right?

You have 50,000 coppers (which are like pennies) and 1,005 silvers. Exchange rate is 1 silver=175 coppers. Most travellers won't take less than five silvers for a skin of Dreamberry Wine (and that's a deal!). Fortunately, you have very good bartering skills. All I ask is that you make it believable. In other words, a traveller will never go any lower than two silvers a skin, no exceptions, and that's with a long argument and a few of your items thrown in.

Happy drinking!

From now on you will tell of your tale in first person.
134.title: Dreamberry Wine

choices: Go down to Mangly road and find a traveler to bargain with....
Find a way to the elf kingdom
1341.content:
This is your unlucky day.
No its not the day you meet Death (come on now, Death doesn't make its appearance so early on in the story).
It is the day you run out of all your Dreamberry Wine!

You try to keep your senses about you, which is easier said than done, as you try to think of a solution to this predicament.

As you see it, you have three options:
1341.title: I am Michael!

135.content:
Blood Wine! That witch must have really hated you..

Blood Wine is the foulest drink known to man. Its name speaks for itself.

It is made by taking regualar wine and adding ogre blood to it. Believe it or not, the taverns do this regularly, for overly drunk patrons who insist on drinking.

This usually causes the drinker to believe the wine has gone sour at that particular tavern and they will stumble out and into the streets. It never fails.

Thankfully for you, tavern owners do this free of charge. See, the ogre blood is shipped in by the kegs from the knights slaughtering them. There is not a whole lot of wine involved in making Blood Wine, so tavern owners feel there is no loss. Hey, they have to get rid of the blood somehow, right?

Asking for skins or mugs of Blood Wine will get you strange looks if anything but they will never make you pay. If you like, you can tell the tavern keeper that you're trying to get your friend home. That usually works.

If I were you, though, I would find the witch and get this curse lifted quickly.

You have 95,010 coppers (which are like pennies) and 1,500 silvers. Exchange rate is 1 silver=175 coppers. You are the wealthiest character at this time. I just figured that if you were cursed to drink such a foul drink, you deserve wealth.

Happy, ugh, drinking!

From now on you will tell of your tale in first person.
135.title: Blood Wine

choices: A true man of valor gets on with his mission
1351.content:
The birds softly chirped above my head. The wind tickled the leaves in the overhanging boughs above my prone body. And the ants formed a long queue into my left ear as they searched for food, tickling as they went.
         I screamed and shot up into a seated position as I belted the side of my head with my fist in a vain attempt to delouse my ear. I found myself at the town common in some unnamed hamlet with little else to describe it save a tiny well, so I sprinted to the well, scooped out handfuls of water, and splashed it all over my face, one vengeful thought coursing through my drunken skull: Drown the little buggers!
         I sighed contentedly as I plopped down next to the well and tilted my head to one side, to drain my ear of any remaining ant corpses.
         I sat there for a moment, deciding whether or not the trees would stop spinning around me before I vomited, when I realized the townsfolk had taken a keen interest in me. I was used to such rude awakenings in strange surroundings, and had exhibited such behavior for many months, and I was familiar with the Blood Wine hangover.
         The townsfolk, however, seemed much less in a fair mood about my vulgar display. They gawked and sneered, keeping to the far end of the road as they passed. A few snickered to themselves, most likely, but I was far too hungover to hear any disparaging comments they might have made -- especially since I had heard them all before. The first thing I lost to my addiction was pride; I cared not.
         What's that, you might ask, addicted to Blood Wine? Impossible! The very thought of drinking such a vile concoction made many a sturdy stomach turn; nobody gets addicted to something that is guaranteed to make them hurl.
         This, of course, is a very true and obvious statement. One that I am all too familiar with.
         There is no excuse for my burden, and I never give one, for no one would believe me anyway. I am pitied, abhorred, a laughingstock.
         I am also cursed.
         Oh, of course! A curse, you say. That makes sense; I mean, who would drink Blood Wine willingly? But then... who would be so devilish as to curse someone with a Blood Wine addiction? A low blow indeed.
         And there is a story to that, one which I will soon explain, but first I deemed it necessary to find my clothes -- the townsfolk were getting snarky.
1351.title: I am Michael!

choices: Ask one of the kindly passersby where I am
No, no.  I want to hear about the darn curse first
13512.content:
My eyes gave a quick circuit of the square: a cobbler, two farm stands, and a smithy banging away in some undisclosed location in the trees. But what I really wanted was the tavern. Every town had a place for its populace to meet and drink, and it had to be nearby because I was too swilled to walk very far. To my left was a small, shack-like structure that looked about as solid as a chicken coop, and its windows were open to allow the urine odor to properly vent.
         The tavern.
         Though it hurt my bare knees, I increased my pace until I was sheltered by its overhanging roof. No sign adorned its facade, maybe folks just used their nose. Another nameless addition to this unremarkable burgh.
         Luckily enough, my belongings were together in a relatively neat pile by the front door, though one boot hung precariously from the roof's edge. I plucked it free and shook out the vermin before returning it to its rightful place upon my foot, then inventoried the rest: a short bow with about a dozen arrows, three daggers kept hidden under my belt, a heavy skin containing bountiful coin, and a crummy sword that I rarely used but kept out of spite regarding its true owner -- the king. I was once King Heddenforth's Royal Bowman to His Majesty's Official Huntsman, which is a lot like being a page, except instead of toiling for a knight, I generally just skinned what the Official Huntsman shot and killed in the king's name. The sword was merely an honorary thing bestowed upon me, and I was supposed to return it when my Blood Wine curse effectively got me fired. I kept the sword, however, on principle. I felt I had been wrongly dismissed, and as soon as I found a way to cure my curse, I would have my old job back and, of course, my sword which bore my title. It was practical, really, not stubborn, to keep it.
         I slung the scabbard around my hip and breathed in the morning air... or perhaps it was afternoon by this point. I needed to get my bearings.
13512.title: Cover yourself, man!

14.content:
That wasn't one of the choices.

Okay, it was, but it was a trick.

I'm very cruel like that.

Go back to the first chapter and pick again.

Death is Death.

He wouldn't appreciate you trying to dictate his life from the inside.

Carry on, then, and please forgive the jest I poorly added.

So this journey ends before it begins.

You chose Death, after all.

Did you really expect the story to continue?

Okay, I'm through rambling.

Really...

Go back...
14.title: You Have Chosen Death...Unfortunately!

info.brief_description: You are traveling with a strange fellow...Death!
info.description:
You are Sharla, a beautiful warrior elf, who has magic powers and posseses a magical stone that guides you to far away places by a mere thought.

OR


You are Shadow, a dark warlock who has only one desire; to rule the world. You have to reach the Tower of Bellock and you only have one life to do it...or do you?

OR


You are Michael, a human archer who fights on the side of good and labors to save those who are lost. There's only one problem: you love to drink and only a witch can deliver you from the spell cast upon you.

Enter Death, who knows all there is to know about you and is the only one who knows where your true loyalties lie. For the evil one may not be the evil one and the pure one may truly be tainted. There's only one way to find out.

YOUR ADVENTURE BEGINS!!

There is but one rule I must impose: All of Death's words must be written in capital letters. For example:

Death replies, "SURELY YOU DO NOT DOUBT YOUR SENSES? THEY ARE ALL THAT YOU CAN TRUST IN THIS PLACE."

And I smile and say, "I doubt only myself."

"WELL THEN. THAT IS AN ENTIRELY DIFFERENT PROBLEM, ISN'T IT?"
